Key Match Events: Enner Valencia was sent off for a lunge on Jose Martinez.
Jeremy Sarmiento scored for Ecuador with a low shot.
Jhonder Cadiz scored for Venezuela from Salomon Rondon’s layoff.
Eduard Bello scored the winning goal for Venezuela by smashing home a rebound.
Post-Match Reflections: Venezuela's win gives them a fantastic platform to attempt to reach the knockout stages.
Ecuador have not won their opening game at a Copa America since 1993.
Enner Valencia is likely to be suspended for the remaining two group-stage games, which may affect Ecuador's chances.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This is just the third time Venezuela have begun the tournament with a victory, having also done so in 2015 and 2016.
It's Venezuela's ninth win in 71 matches at Copa America all-time.
